etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin aequator, in the phrase circulus aequator diei et noctis ‘circle equalizing day and night’, from Latin aequare ‘make equal’ (see equate)

definitions: an imaginary line drawn around the earth equally distant from both poles, dividing the earth into northern and southern hemispheres and constituting the parallel of latitude 0°.
shortDefinitions: line notionally drawn on earth equidistant from poles

definitions: a corresponding line on a planet or other body.
shortDefinitions: corresponding line on planet or other body
